Time for a New AC System?

North Texas summers demand reliable cooling. If your AC is struggling, it's time to upgrade to a modern, efficient system.

10+

System Age

AC units over 10 years old are inefficient and unreliable

$$$

High Bills

Rising cooling costs from inefficient equipment

Frequent Repairs

Multiple service calls indicate system failure

Poor Cooling

Uneven temperatures and hot spots

AC System Options

Choose the right cooling solution for your home

Central Air Conditioning

Most popular choice for whole-home cooling comfort

  • • Whole-home cooling
  • • Uses existing ductwork
  • • Even temperature distribution
  • • High efficiency options

Ductless Mini-Splits

Flexible zoned cooling for specific areas

  • • No ductwork required
  • • Individual room control
  • • Super energy efficient
  • • Quiet operation

Package Units

All-in-one systems for specific applications

  • • Compact installation
  • • Ideal for no attic space
  • • Easy maintenance access
  • • Commercial or residential

Professional AC Installation Process

Expert installation for optimal performance and efficiency

1

In-Home Assessment

Comprehensive evaluation including Manual J load calculation to determine the right size and type of system for your home.

2

Custom System Design

Design the perfect cooling solution with proper equipment selection, ductwork evaluation, and efficiency optimization.

3

Permits & Preparation

Obtain necessary permits, schedule delivery, and prepare your home for professional installation.

4

Expert Installation

Professional installation following manufacturer specifications, local codes, and industry best practices for optimal performance.

5

Testing & Training

Complete system testing, performance verification, customer training, and warranty registration for your new AC system.

Benefits of New AC Installation

Experience the difference modern cooling makes

Lower Energy Bills

New AC systems are 20-40% more efficient, significantly reducing summer cooling costs.

Better Comfort

Consistent temperatures, improved humidity control, and elimination of hot spots.

Quiet Operation

Modern AC units operate much quieter than older systems for peaceful indoor environment.

Reliability

New systems are less likely to break down during peak summer demand when you need cooling most.

Better Air Quality

Advanced filtration systems and proper humidity control improve indoor air quality.

Increased Home Value

New AC systems add value to your home and appeal to potential buyers in North Texas.
